document_title: Acute arthritis: Causes, signs, treatment, prevention
subsection_content:
Acute arthritis can be effectively prevented through a number of scientific diet and lifestyle changes. (4)
1. Diet
Build a diet rich in Omega-3, including: fish (salmon, tuna, sardines...), nuts (flaxseeds, chia seeds, walnuts...), vegetable oils (seed oils) canola, soybean oil...), yogurt, eggs... Supplement food groups that are good for bones, help build bones, strengthen bones, increase bone density, including: low-fat milk, broccoli, tea green, citrus…
2. Physical activity
Regular physical activity is one of the useful measures to prevent arthritis. Accordingly, experts recommend moderate exercise for 30 minutes a day, 5 times a week to strengthen muscles, bones, and joints.
3. Manage weight at a reasonable level
Being overweight puts pressure on the hips and knees, contributing to the destruction of cartilage in the joint cushions. Therefore, maintaining a reasonable weight is really necessary to effectively prevent common arthritis.
In addition, controlling blood sugar at a stable level and giving up smoking habits are also useful solutions that should be prioritized.
4. Control chronic diseases
If the patient has chronic diseases such as cardiovascular, endocrine, or cancer, they need to be periodically monitored and well controlled to prevent reactive arthritis.
